instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.BUTTON_DISABLE: What is BUTTON_DISABLE? BUTTON_DISABLE disables the trackpad when SMC_LID is below 0.5v and the system believes the lid is closed. .
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .
definitions.3V3_S4: What is 3V3_S4? This is an abbreviation of PP3V3_S4, a 3.3v power rail when the machine is in an S4 state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
threads.message:
So this mac had no display at all.
Had a nest of insect garbage under board below cpu.

suspecting lid closed issue discovered <RESISTOR>R5075</RESISTOR> for <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> was corroded and replaced along with <CAPACITOR>C4920</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C4904</CAPACITOR> which were also corroded and coming off board.

NOw I get backlight (no image) and keyboard until boot. I can do pram for 1 chime then I believe the keyboard is turning off and after boot no keyboard or trackpad again.

What in boot cycle would kick on that might supercede keyboard and controller? I reflowed the SMC also. Also noticed if I leave the external display kicked in with lid open it doesn't turn the backlight or display on at all.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
threads.message: Check <SIGNAL>BUTTON_DISABLE</SIGNAL> level.

Does the tracpad click work?

threads.message:
No click either. SMC reset works so there's definitely proper connection there but as soon as I hit the power button the keyboard must turn off, it won't do PRAM reset or go to bootable drive selection screen with option key hold, etc...

I do get proper 3.3V at two points of <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> and at 3.42V and 3.3V on tpad and kb connectors appropriately. 18.5V with cables plugged in at pin 21 j5800

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
threads.message:
Circling back to some of my older projects again...
Yes, 0V at pin 53 with kb and tp connected. 
Power button works before and after boot. I tried changing the firmware chip for entertainment. NO changes regardelss of anything I've tried. Moved it to completely different TP/KB and nada. I was able to do PRAM reset with external but can't detect keys are registering other than the power key.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
threads.message:
PRAM reset, also SMC reset, are done by hardware; corresponding keys go directly to specific chip (<CHIP>U5750</CHIP>).
For normal use, keyboard information (trackpad too), is decoded into <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> and sent to PCH via USB.
You may have a problem with <CHIP>U2700</CHIP> (USB Hub); check its area.

threads.message: swapped out <CHIP>U2700</CHIP> and tried swapping <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> again to no avail. THinking I should just toss it into the parts bin unless you have any thoughts. I checked traces from keyboard to <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> to <CHIP>U2700</CHIP>. I don't get it. PCH?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
threads.message: I'm lost with this board. Now I have no 18.5V at tracpad connector J5800. no <SIGNAL>Z2_BOOST_EN</SIGNAL> WITH trackpad connected (tried multiple AND new j5800 just out of desperation). Does keyboard ALSO need to be connected? I have <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> at J5800. Something must not be getting to J5800 for it to send 3.3V to <SIGNAL>Z2_BOOST_EN</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
threads.message:
TP is independent, no need to connect KB.
Did you try known good TP and flex?
Check your job on <CHIP>U2700</CHIP>; resolder original <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> and <CHIP>U2700</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
threads.message: Yes J4700 works. I was able to get 18.5V back at j5800. I'll check voltage again TO <CHIP>U2700</CHIP> but if that's ok i assume its a trace from <CHIP>U2700</CHIP> to next stop but not sure what the data output pins are on <CHIP>U2700</CHIP> OR it looks like USB may also come through <CHIP>U2700</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
threads.message:
J4700 port do not pass through <CHIP>U2700</CHIP>.
Seems that you have a problem with <CHIP>U2700</CHIP>, or its communication with PCH.

threads.message: Yes, but remove <RESISTOR>R5701</RESISTOR>/02 to open connection lines with <CHIP>U2700</CHIP>.
